comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Now the Department of Education Building in Bridge Street (built 1915). Google Street view - maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&ll=-33.863462,151.210681&a...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Yes! But I always thought it a particularly ugly and forbidding building. It seems top-heavy and "frowning" with that overhanging top storey. Particularly when compared to the Department of Lands Building next door. g.co/maps/4k73g c.1915 seems late-ish for the Series 4481, but not impossible. There is an unusually interesting and detailed Wikipedia article, which talks about the style of architecture (like this entrance door) as being "Edwardian Baroque", inspired by classical and renaissance Italian buildings - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Department_of_Education_Building

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: This building received an internal renovation around 1994 which was.......ordinary. Strange spaces, economical materials and uncomfortable junctions with the original fabric.
